nodes.bodyText:
Discord comment:
Banner and enchantment table only need to extend NameableBlockEntity because of inheritance

Rename to gameProfile
Rename key to GAME_PROFILE

nodes.bodyText: Note that this is somewhat of a misnomer. The TileEntity is only going to exist while the piston is extending or retracting. It'd be better to explain that while a Piston can be sticky or normal, the Piston as a BlockEntity instance is serving only to produce "movement" of the blocks being pushed (I know this because I've had to work around these sort of changes in the world with the enhanced tracker).

So what I've thought from that statement is the piston type doesn't really apply in this case. A look at the wiki for the data structure does show an extended value (which we have)  and I don't really see a is sticky attribute. So remove that value from the block entity? (of course the piston block type would still accept that key)
Ive removed the PistonType from the block entity and added a data value for getting the state which the piston block entity represents.
